hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: FEDERATION_BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: The federation branch name to run the regression.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
hostname env pwd
. /sifive/tools/Modules/3.2.10/init/sh . /sifive/tools/Modules/3.2.10/init/bash
echo $WORKSPACE export JENKINS_BUILDS_DIR=/scratch/jenkins/archived-builds
# Create the Jenkins build dir if it doesn't exist mkdir -p $JENKINS_BUILDS_DIR cd $JENKINS_BUILDS_DIR echo $PWD
mkdir -p $JOB_NAME/$BUILD_NUMBER cd $JOB_NAME/$BUILD_NUMBER echo $PWD
export TEST_BRANCH=sc_priority_xbar_master
# 1. get the git repo git clone git@github.com:sifive/federation.git cd federation
export FEDERATION_GIT_HASH=`git rev-parse --short HEAD` export FEDERATION_ROOT=`pwd` export TIMESTAMP=`date '+%m%d%Y%X'`
# 2. update submodule, redo it if checkout new version ./scripts/quick-submodule-update # 3. create the build folder for generating the design and running simulation # Choose a proper config for your experiment, in this case the config is coreip_viu75_256mc # If there is a customized json for testing , update the DESIGN_SPEC path in mk/base_configs/${config}.mk to your json BUILD_DIR=builds ./generate-build coreip_viu75_256mc # 4. goto the build folder of your config cd builds/coreip_viu75_256mc # 5. generating the design and sim folder make sim # 6. goto the sim folder cd sim # 7. setting the environment for simulation source ../load-modules source ../../../rc.d/riscv-tools.bashrc # 8. running simulaton # If you have already run it, and did not change any verilog code, can just add --nobuild to skip the vcs compilation ./sitest --rundir=sim --sim=vcs --jobs=20 @../../../test-outlines/frontport_stress_uvm.outline -b # 9. get result, which is extract from the report of wave_report # (https://sifive.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/T/pages/692622277/wave+report) grep ".*len.*,.*,.*,.*,.*,.*,.*,.*" -h sim/frontport_stress_uvm.outline/*/*/bw.out
